content.description:
Climb fun mantel, roof, and dihedral moves up to a thin face close to the crux corner of

Peanut Gallery

. Do a balancy move to get up to a 1/2" crimp rail, follow the rail to the right on thin footholds, and then reach around the arete to a good sidepull. Work your feet up, and pop for good holds at the top. Some of the small flakes are less than solid.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is the fourth bolted route from the left on the central buttress of the East side. It is the rounded arete to the left of the distinct twin corner of

Fight to the Finish

.

content.description: Spectator Sport ascends progressively more difficult slab. Stay on the bolt line for hard slab climbing at the top, or bail out left.
content.protection: 10 bolts and a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is the first bolted route right of the man chimney/crack cleaving the east side wall left of

The Comp

.

content.description: Great moves, beautiful position, stellar views, and warm afternoon sun make this climb worthy of its namesake. A few easy clips up a slab warm you up for the technical stemming crux, just below an obvious horizontal, followed by a steep layback sequence.
content.protection: 9 bolts to 2 bolt anchor. Optional 2"-3" cam(s) can be used to anchor the belayer at the ledge.
content.location: This is currently the leftmost route on the East Side of the Arena (the right, west-facing, wall as you enter from below). Head down a few feet from the saddle between De Spectaculus Tower and East Side, and scramble up and right to the belay ledge below the first bolt.

content.description:
From Tod Anderson's

Rampart Range Rocks

:

"Fall on this one and you may hear some boos from the peanut gallery.  Go straight up through some large features to a shallow, right-facing corner.  Tenuously stem up this to the anchor.  This may be height-dependent."
content.location: This is on the East Side of the Arena, it is the 7th route from the left (or 6th bolted route).  Start from the right side of a ledge.

content.description:
This is a great line on the west-facing monolith at the Arena!

This line is fairly easy to spot.  Looking at the west-facing wall (on the left as you come into the Arena), there is a slabby section that rises to a spot where the wall then gets steep.  Just right of this slab is a section of wall that is steep all the way.  Maximus follows this steep portion.  It goes up a section of slightly overhanging red stone that is pretty obvious, about 80 feet long.

Starts fun and leads up to a section with a tough undercling. Work your feet high and match on a high left rail.  Smear on the wall on poor feet and lunge left to a good hold. This section is the crux, probably 11d/12a.

Continue up to the last bolt and a tricky 11c finish.

Photo below is Nate Adams nearing the anchors of Maximus.  He is actually on an easier left hand route that comes to the same anchors.

Beautiful stone!

Fight to the Finish starts easy and keeps getting harder. Head up to the double dihedral, and use laybacks and stemming to move up. The crux is up at the top and involves some technical high stemming and a long reach to a good pocket in the crack.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is on the central section of the East Side, it is the distinct double corner on the right. Currently, it is the last bolted route to the right.

content.description: The first two thirds of the route is pretty easy climbing up blocky, fairly low angle terrain up to a good ledge and alcove. Move up through the small roof to good crimps on the face above. Clipping the anchors is a bit tricky. Step right for better holds, and reach back left to clip. This route gets a 10d rating in the guidebook, but four of us felt it was a bit easier.
content.protection: 8 bolts plus a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
There are 5-6 routes on the central area of the East side between major cracks. There is a nice, flat ledge behind a tall dead pine tree, and this second bolted line from the left, between Spectator Sport and

Peanut Gallery

.

content.description:
This route is more commonly done without its burly

extension

. Meander up the slab to attack the beautiful headwall through some fun moves on a mini-arete guarding the chains. While not as classic as the neighbor to the left, this shares its anchor with

Maximus

and allows one to easily hang the draws and preview.
content.location: It is the middle of three bolted lines on this proud panel. The anchors are above the large pod.

content.description:
Fairly moderate terrain leads to the

1st anchor (11b)

shared with

Maximus

. Crank for 5 more bolts to the top of the wall for the bonus points!
content.location: It is the middle of three routes on this panel.
